net.sepp_tember.lib.randomizer

Class Randomize

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sepp_tember.lib.randomizer.Randomize
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public final class Randomize
extends Object
    Utility class to create randomized lists out of standard lists. The sequence of elements provided by iterators of randomized lists is in a random order. The kind of randomization of the elements is specified by RandomizeType and could be for example in an equal distribution, or also a weighted distribution.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        @Deprecated
public static <T> List<T> list(List<T> backingList,
                                           RandomizeType randomizeType)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the specified list as a randomized list with an distribution specified by the given randomize type. The iterator of the returned list provides the elements of the list in a random order. The list itself immutable, that means all methods that would modify the state of the list, for example List.add(E), throw a UnsupportedOperationException.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the lists elements
        Parameters:
        backingList - the list to be randomized
        randomizeType - the kind of randomization
        Returns:
        a randomized list
        See Also:
        DeprecatedRandomizedList

      • weightedUnlimitedRandomization

        @Deprecated
public static RandomizeType weightedUnlimitedRandomization(double[] weights)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a randomization type for a weighted distribution of elements. The specified array of weights has to have the same number of elements as the list that is randomized by this randomization type.

        Note:

        If the number of elements differ at the moment as the iterator of the randomized list is created, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        The sum of the weights should be equal to 1. If the sum exceeds 1, all weights above this limit will be ignored and the elements associated with this weights are never returned by the iterator. The weight of the first element which exceeds the sum of 1 is truncated to a weight which would lead to the exact sum of 1. For example three weights like [0.7, 0.5, 0.2] are effectively like [0.7, 0.3, 0.0], as the weight of 0.5 exceeds the sum of 1 it is truncated to 0.3 and the weight of 0.2 is totally ignored.

        Parameters:
        weights - weight of elements for distribution
        Returns:
        randomization type to be used with list(List, RandomizeType) to randomize a normal list.
        See Also:
        list(List, RandomizeType)
